org.cougaar.lib.web.redirect
Interface ServletRedirector

All Known Subinterfaces:
ServletRedirectorService
public interface ServletRedirector

A redirector / tunneler for servlet requests.

Field Summary
static int DETECTED_LOOP
          A redirection loop has been detected.
static int NO_NAMING_ENTRIES
          The naming entries for the target do not contain a usable entry for this redirector.

          The specified options are not supported by this redirector.
static int OTHER_ERROR
          Some other, non-fatal error.
static int REDIRECTED
          The request has been redirected or otherwise committed.
 
Method Summary
 int redirect(java.lang.String encName, java.util.List options, NamingSupport namingSupport, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
          Redirect/Tunnel a servlet request to the specified remote agent.
 

Field Detail

REDIRECTED

static final int REDIRECTED
The request has been redirected or otherwise committed.

This is the "success" case, even if it calls "res.sendError(..)".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NOT_SUPPORTED

static final int NOT_SUPPORTED
The specified options are not supported by this redirector.

This case is common if explicit options are specified. Typically a null options list is treated as a wildcard and always supported.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

NO_NAMING_ENTRIES

static final int NO_NAMING_ENTRIES
The naming entries for the target do not contain a usable entry for this redirector.

For example, an HTTP redirector may find that there's no "http" entry in the naming service for the remote agent.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DETECTED_LOOP

static final int DETECTED_LOOP
A redirection loop has been detected.

For example, an HTTP redirect might find its own host:port for a "remote" agent, yet if that agent was local then we wouldn't have called the redirector.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OTHER_ERROR

static final int OTHER_ERROR
Some other, non-fatal error.

For example, the naming entry may be invalid. This is in contrast to a committed error case, in which case our redirector should throw an exception or call "res.sendError(..)" and return REDIRECTED.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

redirect

int redirect(java.lang.String encName,
             java.util.List options,
             NamingSupport namingSupport,
             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                    java.io.IOException
Redirect/Tunnel a servlet request to the specified remote agent.

A standard solution is to lookup the request's scheme in the map and HTTP-redirect the browser to that remote host:port. Another option is to tunnel the request for the client.

Parameters:
encName - URL-encoded remote agent name.
options - URL-decoded redirect control options, as specified on the request path. For example, "/$_^foo" is parsed as ["_", "^"]. The meaning of these control options is redirector-specific. Typically these options are only specified to override the default behavior, e.g. to turn off HTTP-redirects or use a custom redirect/tunnel capability.
namingSupport - support API to lookup the encName entries in the naming service. See ServletEngineService#getNamingEntries.
req - the http request
res - the http response
Returns:
REDIRECTED if the call was sucessful or otherwise committed, otherwise one of the other status codes.
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
java.io.IOException
